Posts.Content: On 7/10/2007 Leemg wrote: I so understand your frustration.  You really have to be your own advocate when it comes to your health.  I'm going through a similar quandry but a different problem although I had BC over 3 years ago and went through radiation.  I don't understand you doctor telling your if you had recovered from the initial side effects of radiation, redness, itching, rash etc. for several months why he or she would attribute you new problem to the radiation.  I personally only experienced pink and some warmth in the area but I was also given radiation cream from the onset to help with this and as time went on this faded and the skin appeared and felt normal again.  I never suffered any breast pain only from surgery.  Are you seeing an actual breast surgeon?  Or a general surgeon?  Studies have shown that patients know their bodies best and when something doesn't feel or seem right it may not be.  Definitely, find a surgeon or oncologist who hears you and takes your problem seriously.  It needs to be checked further and sooner rather than later.  Yes, I have also heard that BC is more aggressive in black women so even more reason to stay on top of this.  You deserve to have the best treatment available and don't let any doctor push you off.  It is so easy to become just a number to them.  Someone once told me that when you question your doctors, do it in such a manner that you ask them:  if I were your wife, or your mother, sister etc., what would you recommend.  You'll be surprised how they shift gears and give it more thought.  Best of luck to you! Oh Thank you, so much your last paragraph was exactly what I said to him when I was in before my first biopsy the very thing you said about his wife, mother or sister...what he said after that was well lets put your mind to rest and ordered the biopsy and it came back stage 2 Thank you, it is a breast surgeon but he is so busy that I think that his office may be a little overwhelmed. I am so glad for this outlet one of my best friends that I could talk this over with died on june 21 of colon cancer and we were both being treated with chemo and could share our thoughts and fears ...she was my dear sister-friend for over 23 years.   Thank you, for caring and sharing , May God bless and keep you. Rett
Posts.Title: Can someone please give me some peace

Posts.Content: Is this normal ? 2 Mammo's 1 st 5.2 second 6.25       #651456 - 07/10/07 05:21 PM Edit   Reply   Quote   Quick Reply   I have been having pain in my right breast after lumpectomy in Nov 06 , positive for metastatic carcinoma, single lymph node. I starting having breast pain like someone was stabbing me in May went to my surgeon he assured me that it was just my body awakening after surgery but I had not had any problems before than. Went to my primary sent for a mammo on 5.2.07 results..A spiculated density is seen and not really appreciated on the previous exam of feb 06 pre -operative and most likely is related to post surgical changes. Had another problem went back to primary concerned about itching and pain in my right breast sent for another mammo 6.25.07. Results : Increasing skin thickening and density in the right breast compared to the study form one month ago. The main differential diagnosis would be mastitis , Lymhedema recurrent tumor. I recommend the patient have a surgical consultation for further evaluation. Assesment 4-suspicious abnormality, biopsy should be considered ...Recommendation : Suggestive of malignancy-take appropriate action. My concern is when I told my surgeon my oncologist , my follow-up for radiation that I was in pain and I just did not believe it was normal they said no...it's ok just normal after radiation. But I complained about the rash under my breast and the pain that was waking me up and that I could hardly stand for someone to touch my breast. If this is nothing and it does not feel like that, I am a 52 year old black woman if that matters and from alot of reports it does. What I have read is that breast cancer is more aggressive in African-American Woman ..report dated 7.10.07 Science daily. and that we have poorer prognoses. Let me end with saying that when I first went to this same surgeon he said no you are fine , but because I kept complaining he said lets put this to rest and do a biopsy and it came back stage 2 , with 22 lymph nodes removed 2 positive for metastatic duct carcinoma. So when I went in May he again said if you have had cancer we take that serious but a little over a month I am still in pain and had it not been for my primary doctor I was being put off until September. I have 2 sons and 2 grandchildren and a husband that I do want to live for and myself, I just need some help
Posts.Title: Can someone please give me some peace

Posts.Content: On 7/14/2007 Leemg wrote: Hi Rett!  Your words were inspiring and brought tears to my eyes.  Your right, my sister recently told me that those of us who are willing to give to others in their time of need may not always be reciprocated in our time of need so to be carefull not to have the same expectations.  I know some people care but are just not able or willing to as your say "stretch their arms around someone else's pain".  I had an appointment just the other day with my medical oncologist and he said he was sorry to hear I had to go through my current situation with thryoid cancer, that it wouldn't be pleasant for me, he was sincere.  Sometimes that's is all it takes.  He mentioned he thought I appeared to be in good spirits and on past visits he was concerned because I seemed depressed.  The day I saw him I had just received a very awaited phone call from my endo and got some clarification as to what I might expect with my thryoid surgery and both he and my surgeon felt I would do well.  Since I had been so apprehensive about that, it was very relieving to get that news so I guess I had a good day when I saw him.  But there have been tough days as well.  I'm a good one for telling others that I'm supporting that your days are like the weather.  Yes, there will stormy days but there were also be sunny days and days in between.  I have to remind myself that it applies to me as well.  Let me know how your current situation is going.  What is in the planning as far as treatment or follow up for you?  Thanks again for writing! Good Morning, Apparently, our God thought we had the right stuff to be able to go thru this battle. I can remember when I was first diagnoised I told God I wanted to be a good representative, now for a little background.  I was adopted when I was almost 2 the a family in Dallas, Texas ( a Texan)  and my mom died at 41 of Leukemia when I was 9.  But I can remember how she never stopped doing housework or baking.  Well I can't bake !! but I am pretty good.  What I learned was that you can either go thru the things that life has for you standing up or being drugged..well you and I my dear are going thru life standing up and enjoying each and every day. I did a little reading and was encouraged about thyroid cancer I know that the work that our father has started he will complete in your life. You are my evidence that God will send another angel by just when you need one !  My dear I am glad that your doctor was able to take time with you. So we are in agreement that we shall beat this and just live life well each day...I live in Fort Lauderdale, and it's a stormy day today.  So smile you have a friend and I will pray that God will restore you daily !!! Please be blessed and just have the peace that passes all understanding . Rett
Posts.Title: Can someone please give me some peace

Posts.Content: Claudia, Thank you, so much for the information right now believe it or not this is what I am dealing with.  almost hate to answer but of course my last chemo treatment was on the 30th and I was taking off on the 31st making it a long birthday weekend...well Claudia and you know it is going to be something when I start like this...well of course my doctor could not place the needle in the correct place and I left with swelling and bleeding and I had to change  the bandage and that never happens....so by about 3am Fri the 31 I was woke and I had so much pain that I just could not stand it...called both the oncologist and the surgeon Well both did call back and the oncologist called back quickly I explained the pain  that I was in and did I need to go to emergency ? he said no he would call in a perscription on my behalf and he did but my surgeon asked that I come in and he gave me 2 prescriptions ..well at the end of the day I was taking  the pain pills left and right and of course this was the holiday weekend...so my next appointment was on Tuesday at 2:30...when I went he worked me into the  schedule the next day to have the port removed...so I was out all last week spent the birthday and last week taking pills and still taking them....so I am  so black and blue and still barely able to sleep just tired and I was a little scaredon what was happening that I took pictures of the bruising and I of course contacted my primary to get a second opinion referral.... So right now the right breast seems ok but I am now dealing with my left breast and removal of my port..... Thank you for your love and concern Rett
Posts.Title: Can someone please give me some peace

Posts.Content: On 11/15/2007 Leemg wrote: I just went back to your original posting that I read and I'm sorry you have already answered many of my questions in that posting.  I have been going back and forth to this blog and the thyroid blog and the melanoma blog as I have been diagnosed with all three and it gets confusing.  I see you not only have children but grandchildren and a husband.  I don't have any grandchildren but we do have a grand "dog".  I read your situation and all along you knew something wasn't right and no one listened.  We know our own bodies, why doesn't the medical profession listen to what we say.  They are so use to the "norm" they forget that there is always that exception.  I've been fortunate in that my breast cancer team does listen and allows me to be a partner in my care.  My thyroid team, however, associated with another hospital which has been publicised many times as a top notch facility can be a little pompous, (they know it all) and I have to keep pushing and questioning.  Forgive me for not remembering you situation.  Keep in touch! You are sooooo!  forgiven and so wonderful to care enough to even ask. Yes I wish my first surgeon had listened to me but I think I may have to change surgeon as he and my first oncologist were good friends.  Well I am leaving work today and we have a retirement party for 2 professors on Monday so it's going to be a party weekend.
Posts.Title: Can someone please give me some peace

Posts.Content: On 7/12/2007 Leemg wrote: Hi Rett! Just wanted to say how sorry I am about your dear friend.  It must have helped to have someone who understands what you are going through.  My good friend decided she was too busy or just didn't care to be involved when I was scheduled for my 7 weeks of radiation over 3 years ago.  I'm scheduled for surgery once again on August 1st, this time for thryoid cancer and I doubt I'll hear from her in the up coming weeks or months.  My daughters are young adults and pursuing their own careers etc.  It's been lonely at times going through all of this but it has made me stronger.  My husband tries to be there but he is too close and I don't want to upset him even more so I try to put on a brave face sometimes not so brave.  It is nice to have this outlet to share one's feelings.  Best wishes to you as well and God bless! Good Morning, I feel so blessed to be able to see the message in my in-box, I always spoke to my best friend each morning.  So my dear, you're stuck with me I don't have a computer at home so when I am at work I'll be able to reply you know I am 53 years old and I have been blessed to have some wonderful people around me during this, because early on when I first found out my husband and I were not together and he did not come back at first because of my thinking how shallow I would be , please come back because I have cancer but he did come back this past March, I was diagnoised in Oct 06 , surgery in Nov 06...and all that jazz. Well my dear friend, I trust God enough for you and I will ask that He send his angels to keep you in perfect peace ! So here is the little bit of wisdom that I have , I find that not all of our friends or family can come up to the level that we need and that sometimes you only have people in your life for a certain period and than I finally had to ask myself was I her friend or was she my friend and the answer was that I was her friend and she really was not mind (another I thought hope to die friend that left my circle) you can live and forgive them for not being able to stretch outside of their world. God will give you friends for the journey that will help you weather the storm. Be of good cheer , email whenever ! today is a good day and lets say together that we will be happy today. Hey it's Friday the 13th and it's a good and happy day for us !!!! In Gods Arms Rett
Posts.Title: Can someone please give me some peace

Posts.Content: On 7/16/2007 Leemg wrote: Thanks Rett!  You sound like a true soldier for the Lord.  My sister is actually a pastor but I have had difficulty at times with my relationship with the Lord.  Thought I was able to see and be a part of some of His workings in the past but had a situation which cast some confusion and doubt, maybe it was just in my interpretation.  I know He is there but for some reason I haven't been able to reach out as I should and it is not just because of the cancers.  People in my life have been disappointing and this has hurt maybe like l hurt Him by not being there.  Maybe that is what He wants me to feel and understand.  I'm sure I'll have plenty of time to ponder while recuperating from thryoid cancer surgery and preparing for treatment as I've learned it is a arduous process.  Have a blessed day! Well my dear when I was first diagnoised I asked God to help me be a good representative and not just look downtrodden and worn. But I have come to find that God is not like us ...Thank God LoL we really are freely given love and grace and mercy. I just love the way he made provision for us before we were even born...he God just wants to spend time with you and me daily, like any good father he cares and this is one of my statements that has kept me ...he does not love me any more than he loves you , he loves us all the same the best he can.  So my dear no condemnation...the enemy cannot rob you ...so every day I have this note I taped to my bathroom wall right above the tissue...Today I know that God is giving me his best and I rest in knowing that his will is being worked out for me.  So no matter the test or task or surgery we are going to just use the words of the Bible over your life...do not add to them and do not take from them and do not limit God by saying maybe he  is teaching us a lesson. So declare the word over your life and I agree with you that no weapon formed against you will prosper....and that you will not experience all the negative side affects. Be blessed, had my breast MRI done this past Monday and my husband went with me and fell in the hospital due to water on the floor ...what a test ...he had to be seen in emergency but is back at work yesterday. Life is never dull... Rett
Posts.Title: Can someone please give me some peace

So right now the right breast seems ok but I am now dealing with my left breast and removal of my port..... Thank you for your love and concern Rett

Posts.Title: Can someone please give me some peace

Posts.Content: On 7/8/2007 Lisadiane wrote: Hi my name is Lisa I am 43 years old and I am new to the message board. Its not even been a year since I found out I had breast cancer, and now I find my self going threw a divorce, My husband can't deal with the cancer. After 10 years together when I need him the most he's not there. I know I can't be the only one going threw this. I really need the support of others that may be going threw the same thing or has been there and done that!!  Thanks Hi Lisa, My name is Loretta and I am 53 and my husband and I were seperated when I found out about my cancer , breast cancer as well and I went thru the lumpectomy and radiation and started chemo.  It was hard he was in another state and I didn't even have an address and when I spoke to him he said it was unfair to him.  I wanted a divorce but I am a christian and I had to get down on my knees and ask God what do I do ?  I went to church I went to work and I had wonderful sister friends to help me  and even cook for me.  I received a call one day from my husband asking me if he could come home I said yes because I knew that was what God had in store for me.  I know it is not easy but if you are a praying person it is your husband who needs the help , Lisa you will be fine God has you and He loves you more than anyone else.  I pray that you will have the peace that you are needing because really when I was having all my treatments I was glad he was not there because I just needed to nuture myself at that time. I'm still going thru possible reaccurance but whether he is there or not God Is ! Rett
Posts.Title: Divorce and Breast Cancer
